question: The Intensified Mission Indradhanush (IMI) 2.0 was launched across the country. Which disease is not covered under the mission?
explanation: Centre launched the Intensified Mission Indradhanush (IMI) 2.0 across the country. The governmentâ€™s flagship scheme is aimed at immunizing children under the age of 2 years and pregnant women against eight vaccine preventable diseases. The IMI covers vaccines for diphtheria, whooping cough, tetanus, poliomyelitis, tuberculosis, measles, meningitis and Hepatitis B. Vaccines for Japanese encephalitis and hemophilus influenzal are also being provided in selected areas. The IMI 2.0 aims to achieve targets of full immunization coverage in 272 districts spread over 27 States. The IMI 2.0 will be carried out between December 2019 and March 2020.
